site_name: SeaQuest Interactive Aquarium Las Vegas LLC

citations.narrative:
On March 15, 2023, during public exhibition a 2-year-old, female wallaby was handled in a manner which posed a risk of
harm to the animal and the public. During a feeding encounter, a child was sitting on a bench within the enclosure
attempting to feed the wallaby when it suddenly jumped up toward the child with its front paw contacting the child’s face.
One facility attendant was present for this feeding encounter; however, there was not sufficient distance or a barrier
between the animal and the child to prevent potential injury. Per the facility representative, their policy would be to fill out
an incident report if the public member is at the least marked/scratched by an animal. There was no incident report made
by staff concerning this encounter on this day. The positioning of the child and the wallaby without adequate distance or
barriers did not appear to assure the safety of the public or the animal. The public may be scratched or injured if the
animal unexpectedly becomes startled or stressed. Also, the animal may become injured when placed in this position and
during an unexpected harmful or stressful event.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of the
animals and the public.
Correct by close of business 06/07/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
On March 15, 2023, during public exhibition a 2-year-old, female wallaby was handled in a manner which posed a risk of 
harm to the animal and the public.  During a feeding encounter, a child was sitting on a bench within the enclosure 
attempting to feed the wallaby when it suddenly jumped up toward the child with its front paw contacting the child’s face.  
One facility attendant was present for this feeding encounter; however, there was not sufficient distance or a barrier 
between the animal and the child to prevent potential injury.  Per the facility representative, their policy would be to fill out 
an incident report if the public member is at the least marked/scratched by an animal.  There was no incident report made 
by staff concerning this encounter on this day.  The positioning of the child and the wallaby without adequate distance or 
barriers did not appear to assure the safety of the public or the animal.  The public may be scratched or injured if the 
animal unexpectedly becomes startled or stressed.  Also, the animal may become injured when placed in this position and 
during an unexpected harmful or stressful event. 
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with 
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of the 
animals and the public.

Correct by close of business 06/07/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
